page.title: 09VILLAGE SCHOOL HISTORY.
page.content: A school was founded in Abberley in 1717 by {ELIZABETH AND VICTIRIA WALSH} whose family had owned the Manor<Abberley Hall> since the reign of Henry V111,so that poor children of the parish could be educated.A school mistress was appointed by the parishioners and received Â£6 per annum. In1809 BLINT'S TENEMENT<now called THE WALSHES>,was re-built by the lord of the Manor,ROBBERT BROMLEY.A master was appointed to teach 10 boys upon the NATIONAL PLAN,free,and other children from Abberley and Great Witley parishes at two pence per week.In 1833 there were 20 children in the school. In 1855 there were 30 children receiving education. Money was a problem keeping these kind of schools going.In1833 the STATE began to be involved in the field of
